description:
Transceiver:  Table containing real-time operational parameters of radio transceivers in a 5G NR network.

- dateTime: Timestamp of data recording.
- Area_Name: Name of the geographical area where the transceiver is located.
- CellId: Unique identifier of the cell site.
- Id2: Redundant Cell ID.
- Id3: Identifier of the Field Replaceable Unit (FRU).
- Id4:  Likely a secondary identifier, possibly related to the FRU.
- vsDataType: Type of data; specifies that this relates to transceiver data.
- vsDataFormatVersion: Version of the data format.
- Transceiver.mechanicalAntennaTilt: Mechanical tilt angle of the antenna (degrees).
- Transceiver.microSleepTxRadioCapability: Whether the transceiver supports micro-sleep transmission.
- Transceiver.ulFrequencyRanges: Uplink frequency range used by the transceiver.
- Transceiver.microSleepTxRadioStatus: Status of micro-sleep transmission (enabled/disabled).
- Transceiver.totalTilt: Total electrical and mechanical tilt of the antenna (degrees).
- Transceiver.minTotalTilt: Minimum allowable total tilt (degrees).
- Transceiver.operationalState: Operational status of the transceiver (enabled/disabled).
- Transceiver.availabilityStatus: Availability status of the transceiver.
- Transceiver.transceiverId: Unique identifier of the transceiver.
- Transceiver.maxTotalTilt: Maximum allowable total tilt (degrees).
- Transceiver.dlFrequencyRanges: Downlink frequency range used by the transceiver.
- Transceiver.retSubUnitRef:  Reference string to the related sub-unit within the network hierarchy.
queries: Show me all transceivers in Area_Name 'Downtown' with `Transceiver.operationalState` = 'disabled'.
Find all transceivers where `Transceiver.microSleepTxRadioCapability` is true and `Transceiver.microSleepTxRadioStatus` is false.
Retrieve the `dateTime`, `Area_Name`, and `Transceiver.totalTilt` for transceiverId 'XYZ123' for the last 24 hours.
List all `Id3` values associated with `Transceiver.availabilityStatus` = 'Degraded' and `Transceiver.mechanicalAntennaTilt` > 10 degrees.
